creditline: Gift of funds from the Asian Art Council
description: silk padded kimono; brown and white alternating bands, feathered appearance between bands; printed falcon designs with black pole and purple tie repeated throughout
text: The training of predatory birds for hunting and sport has a long tradition in Japan. In the Edo period (1600-1868), master falconers (takajo_) were accorded special rank withinthe samurai hierarchy. This boy's costume is decorated with falcons as a fitting emblem of male strength and focused determination.
title: (Boy's Kimono)
